heading: Dear Father
body:
This morning I pray, 
You know how busy I’ll be
The rest of the day, 
If I forget You,
May You forget me not?
If in any way I’m going to assume 
A self destructive attitude,
May it be far from You 
To letting any calamities befall me?

Enlighten me of my ignorance,
Give me a clear conscience,
Stretch my imagination and 
May You perfect 
The visual acuity of my perception?

Keep me thinking straight and 
Help me in asking the right questions, 
In the right order?

May I cause smiles that heal souls and 
Chase away tears. 
May those around me, 
Have confidence in me,
May they respect my judgment and 
May I be a blessing to them?

At the end of the day,
May I be a beacon of hope,
May You find pleasure in my prosperity and 
May You delight in my satisfaction?

Forever and ever, 
And at the end of the day,
May Your will prevail. 
Amen.

heading: The Bride Of The Promise
body:
‘Son,’ 
Daddy God asked me.

‘Now that you have all these; 
What else do you need,
That I may grant it for you,
That your joy may be full?’

I always thank the Holy Spirit 
For guidance and utterance,
For spontaneously I said,
With all the meekness
And sincerity of soul.

‘My Father,’ 
I began.

‘Cause I have found favour 
In your eyes,
Please grant it to me that,
I have a good cause in this life,
A noble, challenging and rewarding 
A vision.
That now my joy may be full
And that I, in old age may triumph?’
With a smile on His face, 
He remarked.

“What a noble request!?
But know this first,
Before you embark on your noble quest
You have to find true love lest,
In old age there is no triumph.

I have blessed your hope
Am teaching you wisdom
And a very valuable lesson,
Your path I will make straight.

On your way from here
You will meet two maidens,
One will give you something to detest
And you’ll give her something
To yearn for,
And she’s not the bride of the promise.

It’s only she,
The bride of the promise,
Whom your heart desire,
Only her, will you love
And your soul long for,
For on this quest of yours
She’s your suitable helper.

I am giving her to you,
‘Cause you need her,
And she needs you

Getup now.”

When I came of age
I learnt, 
The journey was half the reward
And of cause,
I triumph.

heading: It Was AIDS
body:
When I came off creation,
I boarded earth, 
And took a seat in my mother's womb. 
I travelled for about nine months,
Then stopped at the world 
And settled in a suburb they call Zimbabwe. 

From my early days in that hood,
I noticed that, my neighbours 
Where sort of hiding something from me,
However, I did not dare ask,
I dismissed the idea by telling myself that,
‘They have an attitude;
Especially to strangers.’

I noted that, whenever somebody died, 
My neighbours though sorrowful, 
Barely shed tears, at least 
I reasoned that, 
Their tear glands had dried up 
Because of the constant weeping 
For their loved ones, 
They were frequently losing.

The poor were the worst hit,
At first, I thought it was out of poverty,
But I was soon to learn that,
The richer and wealthier were not spared,
Thus my deduction that 
They were both unhappy out of a common cause. 

I set out to find this cause, 
And I discovered, 
There was a bully in the area, 
He was also a vicious and ambitious killer, 
And he was at his very peek of his spree, 
Killing, murdering and assassinating. 

With my enquiring mind, 
I learnt he had wrecked havoc
For close to three decades.
I asked myself, 
‘But why for all these years,
 Had the law enforcement agents 
 Failed to nail down the culprit?"

I found no logical answer, 
Hence my conclusion that,
They had joined him, 
As the old saying goes,
"If you can't beat ‘em, then join ‘em." 

My facts also had it that,
In the history of the hood,
There had also been a killer by the name,
'Black Death.'
However, he was not that vicious,
And he was quickly brought to book.

The killer who had taken captive 
The joy of my people
Had no actual name,
He was known generally by how he killed. 
The killer was not 'a she,' he was 'an it,' 
It was AIDS.

heading: Mwari Ngavatibatsire
body:
Suppose, you get to meet with Yhwh, 
Once a year, for a minute
What will you say?

Suppose, you get to meet with Him, 
Once every ten years, for ten minutes 
What could you possibly do?

Suppose, you get to meet with Him, 
Once in your lifetime, for 24 hours
How will you spend that day?

I suppose, 
I would ask Him what He thinks of me,
And then mean to say, thank you.
That way, it would not make a difference,
If I was staying with Him.

Suppose we could never meet with Him, 
Why would we wish to meet with Him?

But suppose, we get to meet with Him
In every person, and we have all the time
How should we treat Him?

I wonder, and leave you to ponder.

heading: Yearn, Learn, Earn
body:
It's not in their nature to nurture; 
They rehearse not to show remorse. 
Should they be creative, 
Their humour goes like 
'The days I love you are numbered.'

They always find something to complain about, 
At one time and since then,
Have always asked, 
What their country will do for them. 
To them, to achieve is not attractive.

Sugar is just sweet, 
Water is just wet, 
The light is white and 
The sun is bright.

Right is right, Left is wrong,
East is east and west is worst. 
Being first is always best.

Even if they be the wisest, 
There still was hope for humanity.

heading: Baptism Of Fire
body:
I had to be hurt and hated 
To learn to love
With tears on my face,
I learnt to laugh.

Because of yesteryear,
I rejoice in the present.
I thank my ignorance,
For all my experience, and
My indifference, for my passions.

I thank you for nothing
Which you did that mattered,
I will always be there 
To cherish and nourish you.

heading: Let Jah Be The Judge
body:
I set out on a great trek, 
A very bold and decisive move, 
For, that was a very dangerous one, 
For that matter.

One by one it was getting us,
And we were falling,
Great in numbers by the day,
A calamity had become a normality.

Despite being a good player,
I hung up my gloves.
My mission was to bell a cat,
For, what was worthwhile to do in my life?

There are some things worse than death,
And believe you me,
One of them was just sitting there
Until it finally got me too.

I sacrificed relations, 
Gave up my youth 
And died to self, 
In the hope that one day, 
In old age, 
I will triumph. 

They asked the wrong questions, 
And judged me, when they knew me not.

They called me names; 
A neurotic and a psychotic, 
A traitor and a sell-out, 
A disgrace to my own family.

From the beginning, 
I was armed with sheer determination 
And discretion; 
And they said, 
I was carrying weapons of self-destruction.

Here I am, 
Having belled the cat, 
I stand head high, 
And though short in their midst, 
I walk tall.

Still, 
In the passing on of time,
Some may call me a saint, 
An idiot savant,
Or plainly, 'a holy shit.'
I am Tatenda Yah, 
The righteousness of Yahweh;
And that's what I'll answer to.

heading: Eve Of The Revolution
body:
On the eve of the revolution
Moments before the trumpet was sounded
I remember seeing their faces
Pregnant with expectation
As we sang
    “The Spirit Says Come.”

The atmosphere was supercharged 
Like on the Passover night
When the first and faintest of cries were heard
And as they waited for Moshe’s signal
To begin the forty year trek

Like then, 
As when Moses stretched forth his hand
To part the Red Sea
The great awe that engulfed them

Like with Joshua
Just before he signalled them to shout
Before the walls of Jericho 
With a great crush, came tumbling down

Anyone who witnessed the event can testify
And for everyone who took part 
An eternal mark they bear
As memories of a great triumphant entry
You see this mark here?
That’s a seal for the brave hearts

Like just before the union jack 
Dishonourably was brought down
And the Zimbabwe flag 
Proudly rose high

The atmosphere, 
As orchestrated as it was
Was defined by the eager expectation
The ignorant confusion
And the fear of the unknown

Have you ever had those moments?
Or maybe it occurred to you just once, like me
When you feel like
Your whole life
Was in preparation for that only one moment

Yeah, for me it was only that one moment
For I was the one to sound the shofar
And it was unlike the near death experience
I had had a few months ago
For then I felt more alive

Now my past met my future
And my future met my past
Then I discovered that difference
Between fact and fiction
Fiction has to make sense
The heavens and the earth
Are to be shaken...
And that love you have
By fire it’s being tried

I remember kissing her 
For the first time in ages,
If hell hath no fury like a scorned woman,
Then, heaven has joy 
Like on earth, fucking with own true love

Welcome to the true love age
The Bride says come.

heading: The Exceptional Man
body:
My father used to say
‘Keep your heart with all diligence,
 For out of it are the issues of life.’

My father used to sing,
‘Simudzai mureza wedu we Zimbabwe.’

My father used to advise,
‘To those who understand, 
Life is just as it is;
To those who don’t understand, 
Life is just as it is.

My father used to think,
The sun moved round the earth,
However, 
He dreamed of an expected end,
He was just an exceptional man.

I don’t know what it means,
But he once said,
‘You are the good works 
That have come out of me, 
And these works will live long 
After I’m gone.’

Though it took him a long time 
To forgive mom, 
What had he to say,
When I asked him about his first girlfriend,
‘My prince, her majesty the Empress
Taught me what love was really about.’

That was Yacie, 
The husband of my mother’s youth.

Though he kept saying I can do better,
What had he to say,
When I failed my team,
At the Hwishu Tournament;
‘You were the most deserving 
Second best.’

That was Yacie, my hero.

Though I discovered it,
And it was named after him,
What had he to say, 
When we discovered that cave.

I said,
‘What a splendid place 
To hide.’

Mom said,
‘What a splendid place 
To paint murals.’

He only said,
‘What a splendid cave.’

That was Yacie, my mentor.

What did he say, 
When I asked him about 
The future of his empire,
‘Son, QBI will not miss me,
Doesn’t it make you proud, 
To know you have been serving QBI,
For ten years now.

That was Yacie, 
Under the guidance of the Most High
The founder of QBI.

Perhaps what made him exceptional is,
He was a believer,
He believed in the best in everyone 
And had a way of imparting his ideas 
Unto man.

heading: Ndangariro Ne Fungidziro
body:
Zvimwe nde zvimwe,
Asi na Ivy taidanana,
We shared almost everything
To say, but the least.
Perhaps, it were only the same parents
We did not share.

Interests, we had the same, 
Aifarirawo ku rara and 
Tairarira mazai e huku. 
We would chat for hours
Incubating them.

It was not always,
When we talked sense,
Ndaiti ndikamu kunda pa nharo dze
'Huku ne zai,' se muenzaniso,
Aipedzisira ati,
'You have mastered the art of talking,
Without really saying anything.'

I remember particularly this day, 
Ndakamuti, 
'Une nharo iwewe!' 

Iye akati, 
'Kwete, handina nharo,
 Iwe ndiwe une nharo,
 Nekuti uri kundiitisa nharo,
 Kudai ndiri ndega ndisiri kumboita nharo.'

When nature called,
We could use the same condom together,
And it was obvious,
We exchanged bodily fluids,
Cause we used,
The same toothbrush.

Hameno kuti chii chakazongoitika, 
'Cause I found myself regretting, 
‘I should have cheated,’ 
Oh yes, with her gay brother.

heading: Your Mind
body:
I once told you that, 'I love you' 
I'm sure, you still have this 
In your mind.

I wish to show you some kindness, 
But, do I really ever, 
Cross your mind?

I know one day I will win you heart, 
But, I have to go 
Through your mind.

Thereafter, I will always be by your side, 
That you may have the peace 
Of your mind.

By fate, I may again be out of your heart, 
But, may I always be 
In your mind

If you can't make the decision 
With your heart, please do so 
With your mind.

I pray that you digest this, 
Slowly and with the soundness 
Of your mind.

heading: A Rare Gem
body:
When I found a rare gem,
A black diamond,
Somebody spoke to me,

“I don't see many folks around here, 
 But if I do, 
 I grant them three wishes."

'I only have one wish to make,'

I said,

'May I religiously;
  1.  Keep my New Year resolutions,
  2.  Lead a healthy lifestyle, and 
  3.  Study hard.

So that I may be smart and strong, 
That I may for long, 
Look at, care for and take care of,
My rare gem.'

body:

So I married,

When I had peace, or
Then I had peace?
Inner peace...

heading: The Unleavened Pizza
body:
I was half way on this journey
When the bus had to pull over
By the roadside
Just in front of one food court

I needed a pizza
The best they had to offer
So I ordered the Chivi Style
Double cheese and double chicken

I needed only to wait 6 minutes
Then I would have it
The steaming medium
All for my good pleasure

Only after about a minute
Did the bus driver start his engine
And drove away
Leaving me to the mercy of fate
For so I thought

When I saw him drive away
I forgot ‘bout the pizza I had ordered
And as unheard of as it was
A rock bun on the counter 
Offered itself to me
‘I love you, you can have me instead’

My hunches told me I was getting lost
But even the lost are found wani
So I said, ‘Ok’ 

And the bun said
‘Take me or I leave you’

‘Hey! That's kind of pushy
Don't you think?’
I thought to myself
‘And you better be good 
As you are claiming.’

So as I ran out
I grabbed the rock bun from the counter
Left a dollar 
And did not wait for my receipt

‘Where do I find 
The nearest car-hire services?’
I asked an old man doing some landscaping

‘Son,’
He began,

‘Why don't u wait, 
Only a few minutes,
And give some thought to it, again.’

‘Why should I?
I retorted angrily

‘Cause I know the driver’
My old man replied.

So I stood there
Like a roman statue
Thinking of my next move
Oh, I was holding a bun
I took a bite; 
Don't remember what it tasted like
I must have looked heavenwards
As I munched

And when I lowered my head
That's when I saw it
What was really happening
Ndakazvishora amana.

The driver had gone to pump in
Some more fuel
Whilst we were being served
Fuck it, unotaurawo ka.

Barely three minutes had passed
When the rock bun started making some noises

‘Hey bozo!
That's not how you eat me
You must really cherish me and
Butter me; left right and centre 
Kana wanga usingandide wakanditorerei’

Kana nemi kuitawo here 
Kuzvimbirwa ne rokobhanzi rakati ndiridye
Paine vanhu;
Vehukama kunyangwe vatorwa?
So I gravely cautioned it,

Don't ever, ever do that again, ever!
Not even in private,
Unless you mean for me
To feed you to the rats

When I checked on the tills again,
My order was ready
And awaiting my collection

Damn!
She's was soo good
So steaming hot
So fucking delicious

I was savouring my meal;
The sweet aroma was to my delight
I imagined myself licking away all the juices
And putting it in, nicely and slowly

She seemed to read my thoughts 
For she made herself look her best
To kill me with appetite and desire
I don't mind, you're mine

The rock bun then went berserk
Among other hostile and incessant
Verbal attacks and harassment, 
Sued me for not paying 
For her bread bin
When she was not a victim,

heading: Kunewe Mudzimai Wangu
body:
We are a team
Our coach and club owner is The Most High
Our opponent is the world
The field is marriage

There are roles we can swap at times
But there are roles we can’t swap
Ndinogona kutorerwa bhora
In such times you will have to do your best 
Kuti ridzoke futi kwatiri
Ukatorerwa I’ll do my best to get it back
Whereas you can criticize me
You cannot question my captaincy
I am your confidante and close friend 
I will never substitute you [again,] 
And wish you could say the same for me 

I want you to know that 
You will get exhausted at times, 
And in such times 
I will draw the opponents away from you, 
When I do get exhausted, 
May you do your best to shield me too?

Tinogona kugohweswa sometimes, 
And lose some matches too
But that’s not the end of it 
At the end of the season
We should be log leaders 
And bring home the cup

As we progress, 
Tichazovawo ne our junior players, 
We teach them by good examples, 
Or they have to learn from our mistakes. 
We might not be in agreement always, 
But remember we must do our best 
To win all matches, 
There is a very great reward 
To be earned for the whole team. 

We have supporters
They may shout anything
Good or bad, timeously or randomly
Know that they are not informed as we are
And don’t hate or hurt your fellow player
Just to please them 
In their presence I will support you
Even when you are wrong
Only when we are at our camp
Will I rebuke you
We may even fight
But know that I don’t mean to hurt you
Or to shame you

Then we have gamblers
Some bet for us some against us
Their fates is none of our concern
But ours is theirs 
As such they are more than willing 
To throw anything at us
Pull any strings for and against us
Just to see to their ends
These are more dangerous
Than our opponents on the field
Our loyalty is with this club
We are a family
The work of a master coach
Who knows his job description
And does it for the love
Yes, for the love of the game 

I am saying this
Because I have played in this field before
So you may have to trust me 
More than you did before.

heading: Usazoti Handina Kukuudza
body:
Once in a while,
Invite my mom for the weekend,
She might really desire to visit us,
Asi zvovaomera kungouya.
Ukavakoka uriwe she’ll really
Feel more welcome.

Imagine her telling her friends,
‘Asikana, weekend ndinenge ndisipo,
Ndirikuenda kumba kwe muroora wangu.’
Kana ukadai shah,
Ndinonyatsotiwo
‘Apa ndakazoroora mudzimai kwaye.’

Kuti uwane favour ya amai vangu,
Pavanotishanyira,
You can serve her virtually any dish,
Asi rangarira kasadza ne lacto.

Generally,
Gogo havadi vana vanotambira mumba, 
Especially muine vaenzi.
Wozoudza vana kuti,
‘Kana tazoenda kwa gogo Gatsi,
 Mukapunza ma vase avo,
 Kana kutsika maruva avo hameno zvenyu.’ 

Patinovashanyira,
You can buy her a lil present
Though she appreciates it more 
When it’s hard cash.

Tip for the day,
Perhaps the best present
You’ll ever buy her is a bible,
A hard cover NKJV in large print.

Kana vachizogadzira yard yavo uripo,
You can offer your hand,
But if she doesn’t ask you for it,
Never disturb a grain of sand.

Usazombogara kumba kwavo,
For more than three days,
Unless she has requested you to.
But still, know when to leave

Usazoti handina kukuudza,
Kana uchida kuwana favour ya baba vangu,
Pota uchinorima ku munda kwavo,
If he asks you kuti ndiripi, answer
"Father, I'm the labour and
With these other inputs together
My king has sent me."

heading: They Said It
body:
Summer said, 
"I'm man's favourite, 
‘Cause I'm the most bright, 
In my time many go on vacation;
They bath in my sun, 
For that beautiful tan; 
For your own information,
In the southern hemisphere
I have the rain 
And am dry in the northern. 
Isn't that, the perfection of beauty?"

"If you are so perfect," 
Autumn began,

"Why then does man put on sun cream?
My touch is Midas.' 
Consider the golden look
I give to the landscape,
Take a stroll in my morning,
Stepping onto rotting foliage,
When the sun streams its blistering rays 
On the dew, 
Creating a kaleidoscope of color, 
And the breeze caresses and
With it carries,
The fresh aroma of nature.
Even the blind agree, 
I'm the definition of beauty"

"How about in the rest of the day?" 
Winter demanded,

"In my time, 
I draw lovers closer together,
The true meaning of family is embraced.
The newly weds, about their partners,
Discover more;
So, 
Whether you go skiing with your love,
Or choose to sit by granny's side,
By the fire on rocking chairs, 
You’ll still add, a day to your life. 
Ask the northern hemisphereans,
My Christmas is second to none."

"As if birds don't migrate, 
And bears don't hibernate,"
Spring retorted,

"I'm the youngest and too, the loveliest.
I come with warmth 
And am embraced by all.
Frozen lakes once again teem with life; 
At long last, trees put on new leaves, 
And the undergrowth
Fallen victim to frost regenerate,
They flower
And give a pleasant fragrance,
Birds and butterflies thrive,
Even the Creator,
When He looked at me, 
He saw that, 
What He had made was good. 
Indeed I am, The Spring of Beauty."

"Knock it off!" 
Mother Nature rebuked,

"You're all my children, I love you
And delight in your differences, 
You’re all beautiful."

When I heard this, 
I smiled as I thought to myself,
'My better half is even more beautiful
Than them, brought together.'

The sun read my thought and said to me,

"I wish your queen had heard that," 
He went on to say,

"You never cease to amaze me.
Not so long ago,
You used to think that
I moved round your world,
Now you're this smart? 
If I didn't mean a lot to Mother Nature,
I would have long ago taken a break, 
And with you, go on a date."

heading: Black Widow
body:
I had been lost
And there I was
Tryin to find myself
Now I was helpless
And it was slowly catching up
Death, a slow and painful one
Painful in the sense that
I was gonna watch myself wear away
And I had ample time to consider 
Where truly my heart lay
Though she was never gonna hear of it
Her name was gonna be the last
On my dry and bleeding lips

Had it been alive
My unfortunate fate
Would have been bearable
It was just a painful sting
Feeling numb and then unconsciousness
Then it would feast
Suck up its meal
But there I was
Caught in the web
Of a dead spider
I felt sorry for myself
But sympathy did not comfort
And hope was slowly slipping
Out of my reach

Yet I still had hope that
Our love was alive
It was at this moment
When I remembered those words that
  ‘...whoever shall call on the name of
  Yhwh on that day shall be saved’

That I also remembered
His words that
  ‘The Spirit of the Lord is upon me...’

The day my son said for the first time
  ‘Baba’

Is the day I woke up
There was this loud beeping
And my eyes blurry
I could not move my body
Save for the blinking only, maybe
My organ was also erect
And I knew she was near
There was this angelic face
Lookin straight at me
Smiling against the tears
Rolling down her cheeks
I could not remember her
But the face looked very very familiar.

heading: The Chapter
body:
I know,
There are fundamental human rights,
Then there are conjugal rights,
The former comes first and prevails
Over and above any other rights.

If I may wish,
Oh yes I wish myself the best of luck
If only you had stayed by my side, 
This could have worked.
How I always fantasized about it,
Walking down life'’s highway 
With my Queen, side by side
Ford rivers together,
Sail across oceans and 
Swim together against the current,
Shoot for the stars and
Venture into uncharted territory
Arm in arm.

I never left
In a jovial mood,
I never wanted to leave,
But to live,

I'll always remember, 
That first day,
When I had the taste of your breast,
We slept and I never dreamed of leaving,
But when I woke up 
You were pushing and shoving me away
The black widow way.

Why I left,
In silence and without closing the door,
And never looked back?
I was bitter, 'cause always
I had to give in to your demands,
And let you win 
Even when I was on the right
As if I've no rights.
Kunewe muramu wangu,
Panorairwa sisi newe teererawo

Handidyire huroyi kunyara and will not 
Sacrifice my liberty for a nice fuck.
The preacher once taught, 
  ‘A woman was made from a man's side,
  To be loved and protected;
  Not from the head,
  To dominate and prevail 
  Over her husband...’ 
That I bought.

Forget, 
Will you? That I was never the one 
To talk much.
But of cause I could be heard or read,
You could have literally read my thoughts,
'Cause I always jotted something down.

That once,
I read to you the book of Esther, 
Couldn’t you abhor the fate of Vashti?
  ‘My Queen,’ 
That was my address to you,
If only my Queen, 
Who was called by my name,
Could have humbled herself...

You were the envy of many
All you had to do was to accept me 
As your king and not challenge the crown.
You said in your heart,
  ‘I will make myself the supreme power 
  In this kingdom, I will make myself 
  More glorious than this 'dog,'
  I'm untouchable.’
But see, how you have fallen.

But I must admit, 
I may look back, though my focus is ahead.
This advice must make you a better person,
In your next chapter;
  “To every problem there's a solution,
And using the right formula is half it.”
'Cause you mobilised an army with you, 
And made a public declaration of war;
I'm taking no prisoners, 
All of you are going down.
However, 
If I see your tears on the door post,
I will Passover you.

I'm back in the game,
To all my fans and fellow comrades
Tell dem,
  ‘Makanonokera Colgate, akatoora.’
That was just a chapter of my life,
And could have been the best,
'Cause indeed, 
I had quit the game
And had made a commitment
Or so I thought,
What a sacrifice I had made.

This could have been avoided,
I have to go, 
That your comforter may come.

heading: Ark of the Covenant
body:
We were there in the ark
Our hearts, cooing and confessing
To one another 
In love’s perfect harmony
As we rose above the waters

It is this orchestra, this drama:
The rhythm of our motion
Our deed and intent
The beating of the rains
And the aura of that which is true 
And divine
That caught the Creator’s attention
I know He said something in His heart, 
He blessed us,
For us He made that which is true 
And divine 
To be forever.

The rains stopped
And the waters receded
I left her among hostile species
For we were back to the old order
Thought I was gonna find
Just the perfect nesting spot 
By myself.
To and fro
Back and forth
Up and down
Round and round
There was none.

So I returned
Miserable, wretched and impoverished
Feathers falling off my itchy skin
I returned to the ark
Perfectly resting on Ararat.
Didn’t expect to find life
Not even the meanest bacteria.

But there she was
Facing the east
Beholding the dawn of a brighter day
With an olive branch in her virgin lips.

I landed
Walked towards her
Cautious of my steps
Lest I might give her a fright
Yet, when I looked in her eyes 
Her soul was just as pure 
As when we first met.
Boldly enough, 
I took from her 
The peace offering
And what had I to give her?
No, not an explanation
If I failed the test of true love
Then sincere gratitude, maybe.

“Yacie, we can make this ark our nest.”

The place I were to erect my house

The other am sho was a kind of shrub

As my home project
In her maturity, the tree
I was gonna find my shade
My warmth, my medicine;
A noble partner in my pleasure
Rest and fresh air

Would have had berries

Round my home
But if I ever needed a wind-break
That’ll be from that tree

The other interested in making fruit

When I stopped all the watering
And the nursing
But the occasional pruning

Good for the eucalyptus

From an underground oasis

Beautiful, flowering and flourishing

Too bad for the shrub
The fruit project ceased
And she withered
Without a seed

Am glad of you

If I don’t, you flourish
Wonder if you really need me too.

body:

Yaiva misodzi, dikita ne ropa,

Stretching an amazing 1500 miles,
Visible even from the moon.
We marched for 5000 miles, 
From Cape to Cairo. 
They launched air strikes,
We still hear, 
The echoes of the Hiroshima attack.
I particularly remember that day,
When we were crossing the Yangtze,
If it were not for our Red Army,
Which positioned itself over us,
Tingadai taka siya nyemba musi wacho.

They shot at our children, June 6
I remember that young girl, 
With a flaming torch; 
And only to erect a ninety metre tall statue. 
Come and see the tomb of our unknown soldiers, 
Heroes par excellence.

‘Cause we wanted foreign troops off our soil,
They branded us a terrorist group, 
First came xenophobia
Then Islamophobia, what for?
We were struck by a natural disaster,
Instead of humanity, politics took precedence.
I was so interested in their campaign, 
'War on Terror'
But the irony and the hypocrisy fed me up.
Huori chaihwo.

It is like what Yacie once said,
'A man steals, 
Kills and slaughters your livestock.
When you ask for compensation, 
let alone an explanation,
He demands that you be vegan.’
“That’s utter hogwash.”

After all, 
They sunk our ship in international waters,
Bombed our prestigious 
World Trade Centre, 9/11
And still the more, 
Were taking our jobs, 'ama kwerekwere.'

If not us, 
Who was going to correct 
The colonial imbalances?
I will borrow these words, 
‘A slave who does not organize his own rebellion
Deserves no pity for his lot.’ 
That lesson alone would suffice.
Hence we embarked on the ever popular
Irreversible Land Reform Program.
Chimurenga che chitatu.

They imposed, 
Unjustified economic sanctions on us, 
The so called restrictive measures. 
If change cannot come by evolution, 
Should it be brought about by revolution?

Down with the New World Order, 
As crafted by man. 
She has fallen! She has fallen!
Babylon the Great, 
The mother of harlots. 
Just as a sling shot, 
When it starts losing momentum, 
And about to take its inevitable fall, so is she. 
We asked her to apologise, 
For her evil slave trade, 
She refused, saying, 
'It was legal at the time...' 
If so, don't preach to us about democracy. 
Tell that to your marines.

Aka bvunza,
'Ko ava ndevana ani, 
Vaka pfeka nguo chena?' 

Zvikanzi,
'Ava ndivo vaya, vaka suka nguo dzavo, 
Mu ropa re Gwayana.'

Uchange uri mumwe wavo here?

We might survive, 
The next global crisis, 
And probably the next,
But how many do we have to face, until what? 

I know oh yes, 
I know I'll always bell these cats, 
One after the other, 
Like what I've just done.
As long as I have opportunity, 
I'll do good,
I'll live and let live, 
Love and let love.
I have discovered, 
Anything done outside of love
Is meant to dominate and/ or 
Disadvantage the other man.

Oh Zame, shanduraiwo nyika ino ive nani, 
Tangai neni?

But I wonder:
Who beheaded Marie Antoinette?
Who inspired him to exterminate the Semites?
And who shall speak of, 
The persecution of the Ishmaelites?
Why assassinate Kennedy?
Who's responsible, 
For the demise of the mighty Rome,
Where's The Soviet Union?
Who wanted my nation labelled an HIPC?
Why, when we died for this country?

I forgive you, but will not forget
And you'll never see me crying...

subheading: When he was released from prison
heading: The Psalm Of Barabbas
body:
When he was released from prison
I will tell of the decree: 
Yahshua said unto me, 
That day before Pilate, 
‘Thou art my son; 
This day have I begotten thee. 
Ask of me, 
And I will give thee the nations 
For thine inheritance, 
And the uttermost parts of the earth 
For thy possession’

And so for me was fulfilled 
The words of Isaiah the prophet
Indeed, 
It is easier for heaven and earth to pass, 
Than for the tiniest bit of his word to fail

Now your son stands among them 
Who washed their robes 
In the blood of the Lamb, 
They who didn’t love their lives 
Even unto death 
And have defeated the adversary 
By His blood 
And by the word of their testimony.

Your son is one of the many you redeemed,
Even though he never knew who you were
At the time. 
I was in prison for treason 
And manslaughter, was arrogant and 
Unrepentant and was dying in my sins, 
But you knew me even before I was formed 
In my mother’s womb 
And loved me tenderly, 
I marvel at your saying, 
‘For all the hairs of your head are numbered…’ 

You saved me and my enemies did not 
Triumph over me. 
I reluctantly accept the crown 
You bestowed on me, though you say,
‘Well done good and faithful servant…’
But it’s by your abundant grace
That I have been faithful over that very li'l.
I was surrounded 
By so great a cloud of witnesses 
And by your Holy Spirit I let go
Of all the sin 
Which so easily ensnared many. 
Hosanna in the highest, 
The King of kings and Lord of Lords.

subheading: When he was fleeing Ririti Nyatene
heading: The Psalm of Tatenda Yah
body:
I have but one prayer 
To you my sovereign ruler, 
I have but one desire 
Please do not deny me. 
This I ask of You, and it doesn’t matter 
Whether I have never existed or 
I live eternally; 
It is that Your joy, peace, prosperity, grace,
Truth, love, life and light reign supreme 
Upon Your Israel, 
That the wedding feast of Your Lamb 
Not tarry anymore and that 
I be with my family.

heading: The Psalm Of Jacob
body:
Who is better qualified
To proclaim of your goodness 
Than he who knows what it’s like
To sow in tears and reap in joy? 
Holy holy holy, 
Thou art holy my Adonai
Your servant delighted in you and
You gave him the desires of his heart,
You have redeemed him
And shown him Your salvation 
Indeed, your promises are yes and amen
My Abba Father.
I came of age in triumph
Lived, dwelt and rested in peace.
May all the power, glory, honour, dominion and
Blessing be unto you my Elohim?

subheading: To the music producer DJ QaC. The psalm he sang at the wedding feast of the Lamb and His bride
heading: The Psalm of Tatenda Yah: 2
body:
Yisrael of Yah went into slavery
For the Power of His mighty to be seen,
The chosen people by the mighty hand of Elohim
Were delivered from pharaoh.
Yhwh, was with them in the desert, 
Forty years being who He is to His people
Teaching them His Torah.
We read in the Talmud
Of His everlasting love for His people, 
And the power of His salvation, 
His righteous judgement and 
His enduring mercies.

Yisrael was enslaved and delivered
For the Torah to be written.
For You knew the plans
You had for our Fathers,
Plans of hope and a future,
Our fathers besought You
With all their heart and they found You.
When their groaning came before You,
You left Your throne for their cause.
They were like they that dream, 
When Your highness turned away their captivity.
Our sovereign ruler loves justice, And
Hates robbery with iniquity; 
You gave us our recompense in truth, 
Then made the everlasting covenant with us.
How excellent is Your name, 
The mighty one of Yacob,
May all the glory, power, dominion and
Honour be unto You,
Our echad Adonai 
For ever and ever.

Yahshua came for the lost sheep of Yisrael
To find a bride for Himself
He wrote her the New Covenant
Who believed our report? 
When we proclaimed in all the lands,
‘To us a child is born
To us a son is given
And the government will be
Upon His shoulder,
Him who gives beauty for ashes
Yahshua Ha Mashiach,
Pele-Joez El-Gibbor Abi-Ad Sar-Shalom.’
He paid for His bride by His blood
Cleared her debt and overcame death.
The bride sings,

‘O death, where is thy sting? 
O grave, where is thy victory?’

Forever will He be with us
Behold! His tabernacle is with us, and
He dwells with His bride, 
We are His, and
He belongs to His bride, our God. 

Lo!
I wrote DOVA for you Huchi
It’s a family tradition.

heading: The Legend of BhagedhiNeHafu
body:
//Genesis begins//
The following text was obtained 
From the various Korekore oral traditions that survived, 
Of one of the most mysterious figures 
In the history of the great land 
Which we now call Zimbabwe. 
It occurred before the builders 
Of the great Zimbabwe began 
That half a century’s work.

I have never seen [actually never heard] 
Of a man who divided opinion 
As much as did this BhagedhiNeHafu.

However, the poems herein are manuscripts
Which I unearthed in Bako ra Yacie, 
While I was digging 
For the elusive evidence 
Into this BhagedhiNeHafu character.
I managed to translate them 
From that old Shona dialect, 
Some into modern Shona and 
Some into English, 
Whichever seemed best fit 
To convey the meaning and 
Preserve the style of the author. 
I hope I have done my best 
To present them as clearly as possible, and
In a way that I hope BhagedhiNeHafu
Would have approved of.

BhagedhiNeHafu murume
Aiva wekwedu kuma Korekore uko, 
Aisazivikanwa kuti akabva kupi, 
Mukutaura kwake iye aiti 
Akangozvarwa akakura, 
Airima zvikuru asi aiva nenungo.
Chakanyanyopa mukurumbira 
Ku murume uyu ndechokuti 
Aiva nerimi re moto raaichengeta. 
Rimi iri raigara richipfuta 
Asi hapana aiziva kuti rinorevei 
Uye kuti rakabva kupi 
Uye hapana akamubvunzawo nezvazvo
Waakapindura zvinogutsa.

Murume waidya hake iyeye, 
Aipedza bhagedhi ne hafu 
Ndokuti yake ipere. 
Aiti kana achidya 
Vamwe ndo vanenge vachizvimbirwa.

Murume uyu akazobva kuma Korekore
Ndokuuya kuma Karanga, 
Ndokubva adanana neimwe mhandara.
Mhandara iyi ndokumboedza
Kumunyengetedza kuti airoore 
Asi iye akaramba achiti
Nguva yaiva isati yakwana.
Vakabva vaparadzana havo
Ne mhandara yake iyi, 
BhagedhiNeHafu paakaedza
Kunyengetedza mhandara yake iyi 
Kuti ivimbe naye, 
Mhandara yacho yakaramba 
Ndokubva yaenda kune imwe nyika irikure.
BhagedhiNeHafu zvakamurwadza zvikuru,
Chipo chake chekurima 
Ndokubva achisendeka. 
Akanga ava mushuzhi zvino.

BhagedhiNeHafu achiri kushungurudzika 
Akabva asangana nerimwe svikiro rechikadzi,
Svikiro iri rainzi Ririti Nyatene
Mwenga we Chirorodziva. 
Svikiro raiva ne matinji iroro amana;
Rakavimbisa BhagedhiNeHafu 
Kurapa moyo yake, 
Ndokumuudza kuti aita rombo rakanaka
Nekuti svikiro iri raivawo mhandara
Uye raiva roda kumboinzwawo 
Iyoyi yakazadza nyika, 
Rakabva ramuti atizire kubako kwaraigara.
BhagedhiNeHafu akaita chisakaitwa,
Kwava kurifongoresa mubako imomo,
Asi haana kuripa mbeu yake, 
His seed was a preserve 
For that ‘Daughter of Pedigree.’ 

Chiriporipocho, iye ne svikiro iri
Vakabva vaita mutambo wekubatanidzwa,
BhagedhiNeHafu ndokubva atangawo kunzi Sviviro. 

//Genesis ends//
________________________________________
//The Exodus begins//
BhagedhiNeHafu, 
Abengenuka ndopaakazoda kutanga
Kurarama hupenyu hwake chaihwo,
Achishandisawo chipo chake 
Chaakapuwa na Zame. 
Svikiro riya ndokuti hapana iyoyo, 
Tichadya zvatinopiwa nevanhu, 
Uye ndini ndonzwa izwi reku Nyikadzimu
Saka uchaita zvandinoda. 

BhagedhiNeHafu akazvidemba
Akakungura kuti dai akangoita hake
‘Chimhandara-maoko’ musi uya.
Nechomumwoyo aingoti 
‘Dai svikiro iri raiziva chiono charinodzivisa...’

BhagedhiNeHafu akamboedza kuonesana
Ne svikiro iri paaiva akamira, 
Asi svikiro iri raingoona kunge
Ruzha rwe pwere, 
Kusvikira musi uyo BhagedhiNeHafu
Akabuda mubako umu. 
BhagedhiNeHafu akanga aona kuti
Aisazova baba mubako umu, 
Kana kuonekwawo sa saimba.
Zvakava pachena kwaari kuti svikiro iri
Harisi rumbabvu rwake, 
asi mumwe mutumbiwo 
Unotoda mbabvu yawo, 
Ndosaka rainzi Ririti. 
Naizvozvo iye akaona pasina 
Ramangwana rakajeka uye rine tariro 
Saka hoyo akabudawo neimwe ninga
Yakanga yakavanzika.
Ninga iyi yaiva dikisa zvekuti
BhagedhiNeHafu akangokwanisa kubuda
Ne shashiko chete. 

Zvadaro, akabvapo ndokunoita kamusasa
Musango raiva mujinga megomo
Raiva ne bako iri.
Svikiro riya rakatevera rikanoparadza
Musasa uya pamwe nekutora nyama yese
Yaaiva avedzenga. 
Izvi zvakaitika apo BhagedhiNeHafu
Aiva ambonotarisa mikoko yake.

BhagedhiNeHafu achiri kanhambwe
Akazviona kuti zve musasa hapachina
Asi akangosvika hake
Ndokudzungudza musoro and in a way
As if he was silently saying,
‘Saka ndozvawaireva nhai,
Pawakati haudye che bamba…’ 

BhagedhiNeHafu akatanga kufamba nesango, 
Otekaira, otekaira and began to waste away.
//The Exodus Ends//
________________________________________
//Judges, Kings & Prophets begins//
Achifamba nesango kudaro akabva asvika 
Mu muzinda wa She vedunhu iri, 
Ishe Makwavarara

Achisvika muchivanze chake, 
imbwa dzakamumhanyira dzichida kunoruma, 
asi paya padzaiva dzoda kuruma
Dzakabva dzangoramba dzakashama,
Ishe kwava kudzidzingira kure.
BhagedhiNeHafu akasvika rovira
Naizvozvo achingamidzwa akapuwa pekurara
Ndokubva achizofumira kupira nyaya yake.
BhagedhiNeHafu achipedza kudaro
Ndopaakaziviswa kuti,

'Svikiro rawakatiza i hanzvadzi yangu.'
Iwe, pakaipa!
Zvisinei Ishe vakamuudzawo kuti 
‘Nyaya yako tichazoti toipinza mudare,
Kana kwaita jenaguru uye mhepo yaswera
Isina kumbovhuvhuta musi wacho.’
BhagedhiNeHafu’s condition continued
To deteriorate such that
He developed insomnia and 
In the ensuing months he suffered from seizures
At his worst temporary amnesia.
Akachangomirira kuti nyaya yake
Ipinde mudare,
Nyatene akauyawo achimhan'ara kuti,
Akatizwa ne murume,
Nyaya ikapinda mudare pakarepo,
Nyatene kwava kunamata futi kuti
Bhagedhinehafu abvisiswe mbudzi yedare.
BhagedhiNeHafu akatongerwa kuti
Mwedzi wega-wega apote achibvisa
Mombe inotsika papfuma yake
Achipa svikiro riya,
Kusvikira raroorwa futi kana kuti rafa. 

Nyatene asiiwa kudaro akabva aregera
Kukumbirira vanhu mvura, because
BhagedhiNeHafu had become
Her preoccupation,
Nekuti akanga atadza kumubira
That sacred flame kana mbeu yake,
Akaona zve shayisano zviri nani.
Naizvozvo akatanga kukumbira
Ku nyikadzimu kuti dutu huru rimuwane,
Akungure chaakasiira bako rake. 
//Judges, Kings & Prophets ends//
________________________________________
//The New Covenant begins//
One day BhagedhiNeHafu fainted,
It would have been worse for him
Had not fate intervened and
In that dramatic moment,
Some women came to his aid;
The first shielded his flame
From the raging winds,
Save for sufficient oxygen only,
The orange smoky and flickering flame
Was restored to its brilliant blue hue.

The second woman fed the fire and
It began gaining prominence,
Its base grew,
Became hotter and brighter than before.

The third woman made a back-up fire,
Though not as sacred. 
//The New Covenant Is Ever-living//
________________________________________
//The 2nd Exodus Begins: BNH Forgives Himself//

In the same year, 
While they were celebrating 
The coming of the rain season, 
Ishe Makwavarara overindulged himself, 
And in his stupor his half-brother killed him 
And ruled in his stead, 
That was the end of Makwavarara’s dynasty.

Nyatene was not seen again, 
For close to two years. 
Then BhagedhiNeHafu heard kuti 
Nyatene akafira mudziva re Shurangwena,
But her remains were never found. 
BhagedhiNeHafu mukuziva kwake, 
Dziva iri raisava ne ngwena naizvozvo 
Kana Nyatene akanyura 
Mapfupa ake aifanirwa kunge achiwanika 
Pasi pedziva racho, 
Naizvozvo akanopinda mudziva umu 
Ndokutanga kutsvaga.

BhagedhiNeHafu achipinda mudziva umu, 
Haana kuzoonekwazve…

Meanwhile there came drought 
And civil strife in all the land 
And there was none to consult 
The spirit world on behalf of the people, 
Nyatene was dead 
And the people were awaiting the return 
Of the spirit which was upon her.

To gain confidence of the people, 
And give them some hope of good fortunes. 
Tumbuzviyo, Makwavarara’s half brother 
Now lord of Mahwehwe 
Had incest with his elder sister. 
Tradition has it that, 
On the day of the incest raiva jenaguru, 
Uye mhepo yaiva isina kumbobvira
Yavhuvhuta zuva rese.

Makunakuna aya aitwa Tumbuzviyo 
Akabva anyepera vanhu kuti 
Hanzvadzi yake, 
Maidei ndiye ava homwe ya Tovera, 
Mweya waisutsa Nyatene. 
Nemusi we kuchingamidza kudzoka 
Kwe mweya uyu, 
Maidei aiva akashongedzwa veduwee. 
Mumusoro aiva ne korona 
Yakagadzirwa ne sirivha, 
Iine matombo matsvuku anokosha 
Pamwe ne minhenga ye pikoko. 
Bvudzi raiva, rakazorwa mafuta ainhuwira, 
Nzeve dziine mhete dze goridhe, 
Paguma paine ndoro chena, 
Zvitopora zvekumeso zvichinyatsooneka, 
Muhuro muine chuma chakagadzirwa ne
Magirazi, ndarama, hurungudo,
Nemamwe matombo anokosha.

BhagedhiNeHafu apinda mudziva muya, 
Akaona pasi pemvura paine rimwe bako, 
Ndokupinda mubako imomo. 
Mainhuwa veduwee. 
Kunhuwa kwenyama yakaora chaiko. 
Akange atova mune imwe nyika nhorwa,

“Mwenga wedziva urimo here?”

BhagedhiNeHafu akabvunza 
Achitoenda kumberi, 
Asi hapana akamudaira. 
Kumsoro kwe bako iri kwaiva ne matombo
Akapinza uye emavara mapfumbu, 
Mashava uye mamwe akaita kunge 
Ruvara rwedenga mbichana, 
Ku mativi kwe bako iri 
Kwaiva neninga dzaingovhenganawo, 
Instinct told BhagedhiNeHafu kuti 
Nyatene ari munzvimbo iyi, 
But where to start searching, 
Was his challenge.

Nekugara kwaakamboita 
Na Nyatene mubako, 
Akanga asisavhundutswi nenzvimbo idzi, 
Uye after all he had been through 
He had somewhat metamorphosed, 
At the instance of danger, 
His survival instinct no longer gave him 
A dilemma of fight or flight, 
He only had to fight. 
Akatsvaga kwe rinenge zuva rese 
Pasina chaawana, 
Kunze kwe tsvina ne mazerere. 
Kuzoti zuva repiri roda kutopera zvekare, 
Akanzwa kunge kuuchira 
Nechokumberi kwaaienda, 

“bu bu bu.” 

Akambomira achiteerera kuti anyatsonzwa 
Kuti zvaibva nekupi, 
Asi maungira akamutadzisa 
Kunyatsonzwa zvakanaka. 
Achangoti fambeyi, 
Akoona rimwe bako nechekurudyi kwake 
Ndokubva apindamo. 
Akaona Nyatene akagara 
Nechekuhuva yebako, 
Akazembera kunge akarukutika.
BhagedhiNeHafu akataura akasunga chiso,

“Iwe, ndauya kuzokuburitsa muno.”

BhagedhiNeHafu akabva atanga
Kufamba achienda kwaari, 
Akangosvika ndokumubata ruoko
Ndokubva atanga kufamba naye 
Vachidzokera kwaabva.

Vachifamba kudaro 
Nyatene aingunorondedzera 
Kuti zvakafamba sei 
Kuti azova munzvimbo yakadai, 
Uye aisaziva kuti kunze kwaakabva uko 
Kwaiva kwatopera makore maviri, 
Iye aifunga kuti agara mubako umu 
Kwe masvondo maviri chete.

Vasvika kubako rekupedzisira kuti 
Vachienda ku mvura nekubva vabuda mudziva, 
Kaharabwa ke mukono we njuzu 
Kakabva kasvika kachitoturawo hove 
Ne magakandye zvakaiva kadzimba.

Mazamu ake aiva akangovharwawo zvishoma, 
Kana kuti tongoti minyatso chete 
Ndo yaiva yakavharwa,
Apa akanyatsozara 
Kunge emunhu atotsika mwedzi. 
Kubva muchiuno zvichidzika 
Aive akapfeka hanzu yakarukwa 
Ne miswe yamabhiza, uye iine zvuma
Zvakavhenganiswa uye zviri zvemavara ne 
Marudzi akasiyana-siyana. 

Zvedi Maidei aiyevedza kutarisa
Zvokuti kana vari vanhurume
Vaingogutsurira chero pasina zvaataura. 
Achiona izvi, 
Tumbuzviyo akafadzwa ne zano rake, 
Chipi ne chipi chaizotaurwa 
Ne hanzvadzi yake 
Vanhu vake vaizoteerera. 
Chakanga chasara ndechokuti 
Hosha nenzara yaiva yapinda mudunhu
Yopedzwa sei, 
Nokuti mvura yakapedzisira kunaya 
Musi uyo akagaro chigaro choushe.

Zvino nguva yakakwana yokuti 
Maidei achitaura kuvanhu kokutanga, 
Akasimuka paaiva akagara 
Ndokusimudza maoko 
To the wild applause of the mass.

Nyatene akabva aenda kumashure 
Kwa BhagedhiNeHafu nokutya, 
BhagedhiNeHafu ndokubva atanga 
Kufambisa achienda kuna Katsangamidzi, 
Ndiro raiva zita re kamukarabwa aka. 
Nyatene ndoo paakaona kuti 
BhagedhiNeHafu waaiziva uyauya haasiriye, 
Ndoo paakabva kumashure 
Kwa BhagedhiNeHafu oenda 
Kumberi kwake onotaura naye,

“Bhagedhi pliz, usamuuraye?”

She pled with him, 
BhagedhiNeHafu akabva ambomira 
Achiteerera zvaaitaura, 
Asi meso ake aiva kukakarabwa kaye.

“Ukamuuraya dziva rinobva rapwa”

Bhagedhi took two deep breaths 
In silence uye akatarisa pasi, 
Paakasimudza meso 
Akangobata Nyatene ruoko 
Ndokubva atanga kufamba naye 
Vakananga kumusiwo we bako iri, 
Uko kwaiva kuine kamukarabwa kaye, 
Iko kakangoramba kakamirawo 
Kachi katyamadzwa. 

Vakasvika pakaiva 
Ndokubva BhagedhiNeHafu amira 
Akangokatarisa mumeso chete 
Asina chaakataura 
Apa akanyatsosunga chiso, 
Uyuwo Nyatene akanga opfikura, 
Katsangamidzi akadzuurira BhagedhiNeHafu nzira 
Ndokubva vabuda.

“Sorry hako Bhagedhi, 
ndakaba mbeu yako,”

Nyatene akatanga kureurura, 
Vabuda mumvura zvino.

“Ndakatobata pamuviri,

Ndazoenda kuna Katsangamidzi 
Kunosimbiswa ndipo paakandibata 
Ndokubva andisunga, 
Akandibhinya kakawanda ndokubva ndasvodza, 
Akanditi ndaisafanira kuroorwa 
Kana kubata mwana nebasa randaiita, 
Uye ichokwadiwo, 
Ndiwo mumwe muko wedu, asi asi…”

‘Nyarara iwe,’

BhagedhiNeHafu akamudaro.

‘Teerera unzwe.’

Vakamira voteerera 
Ndokunzwa ruzha rukuru kwavaienda 
Kunge kwaiva ne hondo chaiyo. 
Vakazoti vati fambei ndokuzonzwa kuti 
Vanhu vaitoimba zvavo.
‘…Tovera mudzimu dzoka
Aah ayiye mudzimu dzoka
Nyatene homwe dzoka
Aah ayiye homwe dzoka
Woyera mudzimu dzoka…’

Chembere iyi yaishaura yaiva yakakora
Uye iine gurokuro ne ziguvhudende, 
Asi izwi chete here, 
Yaiva nerakanyanyotsetseka mudunhu mese.
Zvino yaitamba mhande apa ichiimba futi, 
Chiuya uone hako, 
‘Chitaurirwa hunyimwa…’ 
Ndo payakatangira ipapa. 
Payaiti yokweva mweya paya 
Guvhudende raimbodzokera mukati,
Poyofemera kunze raibva 
Raita kunge richadonha 
Nekutamba kwayaiita kuye.

Maidei akachizoisa maoko ake pasi 
Kuti vanhu vachinyarara 
Asi ruzha rwavo rwakabva rwatowedzera, 
Chaunga chaiva kumashure 
Chakatanga kuvhura nzira pakati pavo, 

Apa chichingozhambatata, 
Denga raiva rakachena 
Rakatanga kusviba namakore matema, 
Makore emvura chaiwo, 
Mheni ichirovera mumakore imomo; 
Shiriwo dzaingunoimba dzakabva dza nyarara,
Mhepo ndokurega kuvhuvhuta, 
Vanhu ndokubva vanyatsoti mwiro, 
Apa meso ese zvino akanga ava kumashure uko.

Tumbuzviyo akasimuka paaiva agere 
Nokuda kunyatsoonawo kuti chii chaitora nzvimbo, 
Hanzvadzi yake 
Yaiva yangoshama muromo yapererwawo. 
Ipapo Tumbuzviyo akaona his worst nightmare, 
BhagedhiNeHafu na Ririti Nyatene
Vakanga vasvika.

Mvura ine mutsindo mukuru
Ndokubva yatanga kunaya…

//The New Beginning begins//

‘Baba, chii chakazoitika?’

Handizive, mapeji acho
Haana kuzombobvira awanikwa, 
But tradition says
BhagedhiNeHafu akazoroorana
Ne mhandara yake ndokubva adzokera
Ku nyika yekwake,
Vakaita mhuri yavo
Ye rudo, Mufaro ne chiedza, and
‘The Daughter of Pedigree’
Began to be known as
‘The Queen of Pedigree,
Daughter of the Consuming Fire,’
Nanhasi vachiri vese;
Pane detembo rinonzi ‘Mukwezveri,’
Tikariwana iroro, rinogona kutibatsira.

Nyatene wo akazorega zvousvikiro
Ndokuzova nyamukuta, 
And she died at a good old age 
But haana kumbobvira akaita mwana wakewo, 
Ndiye chembere ye Chivi iya 
Yaunongonzwa ichitaurwa nezvayo.
//The New Beginning lives on//
